question: The Legislative Council of a State can be abolished if:
option1: the Legislative Assembly of a State passes a resolution by special majority and a majority of not less than two-third of members present and voting
option2: the Parliament passes a resolution by simple majority
option3: the Legislative Assembly of the state passes a resolution by simple majority and not less than 1/3 of the members present and voting
option4: the Parliament passes the resolution by special majority and a majority of not less than 2/3 of the members present and voting
answer: the Legislative Assembly of a State passes a resolution by special majority and a majority of not less than two-third of members present and voting
explanation: First option is the correct answer
